intro: Rosa × turbinata f. gorenkensis, commonly known as the Gorenkenska rose, is a hybrid species native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its vigorous growth and profuse blooming, producing large, semi-double to double pink flowers. The plant typically features thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrance and ability to attract pollinators.
